revision.revremark: New file, based on ECO Diesel file + (ALM) Factoring and minor adjustments
Add Tsunami2 Reset values
Added TSU-2200 and TSU-PNP models
Fixed sound selection for TSU-2200 and TSU-PNP models
Added forth compressor type to Baldwin, user reported to exist thou not in Soundtraxx doc's
Added TSU-21PNEM models
Add ID CV 253,254,255,256 and change product ID to values in CV256
Change product ID to values in CVs 253(high byte) and 256(low byte)
Fix function button names
Added TSU-4400 model
Added Poppet Valves select and more PM to Baldwin and other decoders
Added GEVO G12 Tier 4 to GE Diesels and fix bug in poppet value cv
Separate ECO CVs file for Extended Function Map. Add labels to Extended Function map CVs.
New CVs for SW version 1.2. (Diesel Tech Ref.D): CV112,136,141,142,168,173,174,223,314,442,2.296,2.301-302,3.270-273. Added CV123 selection for TSU-4400
Added EMD 2 decoders
Added PNP8 and 21PNEM8 decoders
Fix sound select for PNP8 and 21PNEM8 decoders
Fix sound select for PNP8 and 21PNEM8 decoders
Added TSU-KN1 decoder
Correct Handling of PI (CV31) and SI (CV32)
Added TSU-BN1 and N18 decoders
Rev per TSU2 Manual, chg pane to TSU2
Split vars to include file to reuse with Blunami w/ a few default values corrected
productID change for 11 bit Soundtraxx ID

variable.label: Emergency Stop
variable.tooltip:
When set to 'engine shutdown', the prime mover will shut down
after receiving and emergency stop command.

variable.label: Low-pressure alarm bell
variable.tooltip:
Controls the low-oil pressure alarm bell feature heard prior to
the startup sequence of the selected prime mover.

variable.label: Generator Select
variable.tooltip:
Not included in software releases prior to version 1.2.
HEP: This will change the steam generator sound effect to that of
a small diesel “pup” motor used to provide electrical power
for passenger cars in the train.

variable.label: True-Idle Enable
variable.tooltip:
Not included in software releases prior to version 1.2.
When set, the engine will follow prototypical diesel locomotive operation
and RPM level will remain at idle when the DCC throttle is increased to speed step 1.
If disabled, the engine RPM level is set to notch 2 at speed step 1.
Controls how the engine RPMs interact with the speed step setting of the throttle
variable.label: Engine Notch Rate

variable.tooltip: When this option AND manual (notching) engine control is enabled, locomotive will not move until engine starts
variable.label: Engine RPM Interlock

variable.tooltip: Determines whether prime mover will start up automatically or manually
variable.label: Engine Auto Start Enable

variable.tooltip: Controls how the dynamic brakes interact with the engine RPMs
variable.label: Dynamic Brake Mode

variable.tooltip: Selects which airhorn to use
variable.label: Airhorn Select

variable.tooltip: Choose an alternate airhorn or a short blast of the primary airhorn
variable.label: Auxiliary Airhorn Select

variable.tooltip: Bell sound effect and ring-rate
variable.label: Bell Select

variable.tooltip: Select one of prime mover sound effects
variable.label: Prime Mover Select

variable.label: Prime Mover Select
variable.tooltip:
Select one of prime mover sound effects.
GTEL and GenSet only after Sept 2017 (SW version 1.2)
Select one of air compressor sound effects
variable.label: Air Compressor Select

variable.tooltip: Select one of Poppet Valves sound effects, for decoders built after Sept 2017
variable.label: Poppet Valve Select
variable.tooltip:
Not included in software releases prior to version 1.2.
Selecting the electronic air dryer option will modify the operation
of the automatic poppet valve sound effect to mimic the use of
a Salem or Graham-White type air dryer system.
Like the prototype, when this option is selected the release rate
will be much slower than the poppet valve effect.
Sets the volume of the airhorn
variable.label: Airhorn Volume

variable.tooltip: Sets the volume of the prime mover
variable.label: Prime Mover Volume

variable.tooltip: Sets the volume of the air compressor
variable.label: Air Compressor Volume

variable.tooltip: Sets the volume of the dynamic brakes
variable.label: Dynamic Brake Volume

Adjust the duration that occurs between each subsequent pop! of the automatic poppet valve sound effect
variable.label: Poppet Valve Release Rate

variable.tooltip: track voltage in analog mode at which the exhaust sound begins
variable.label: Analog Mode Engine Start Voltage (0-255)
Prime Mover Pitch Shift
variable.tooltip:
Not included in software releases prior to version 1.2.
Prime mover pitch shift allows for slight variations in the tone and pitch
between multiple locomotive using the same prime mover selection.
- Values 1 to 127: lower the pitch of the prime mover sound effect.
- Value 128: no effect on the tone or pitch of the prime mover sound.
- Values 129 to 255: increase the pitch of the prime mover effect.

variable.tooltip:
Sets the maximum attenuation level of the exhaust sound when the
locomotive is under light load. (higher no. = greater attenuation)
variable.label: Prime Mover Low Volume Limit

variable.tooltip:
Sets the maximum volume level of the exhaust sound when the
locomotive is under heavy load. (higher no. = greater volume)
variable.label: Prime Mover High Volume Limit

variable.tooltip:
to adjust the correlation between the throttle setting and motor load sensing
sets how much the load signal is affected by the model accelerating/decelerating
variable.label: Load Sensitivity
Turbine “Backfire”
variable.tooltip:
Not included in software releases prior to version 1.2.
Backfire on first start has been enabled by default allowing
the unique sound effect to play once, then the turbine will start and operate normally.
If power is maintained to the decoder, each subsequent startup sequence
will not contain a backfire sound effect.
If backfire on every startup is selected, the sound effect
will play each time the turbine is started.
Upon completion of the backfire sound effect, the turbine will then conduct
a successful startup sequence and function normally.

variable.label: Turbine Start Speed Step
variable.tooltip:
Not included in software releases prior to version 1.2.
Allows the user to select a speed step between 1 and 126
at which point the turbine will turn on.

variable.label: Turbine Speed Step Limit
variable.tooltip:
Not included in software releases prior to version 1.2.
Limits the maximum speed the locomotive
when the turbine engine is not running.
A value of 0 is selected, the locomotive speed is not limited.

variable.label: Turbine Timeout
variable.tooltip:
Not included in software releases prior to version 1.2.
Specifies the number of seconds before the turbine engine
will shut down when the locomotive is at speed step 0 (fully stopped)
and the turbine start/stop feature (F16 by default) is off.
A value of 0 will disable this feature.
